meanings.definition: Wrongful or criminal deception intended to result in financial or personal gain.
meanings.sent1: The scam artist was arrested for committing fraud by tricking people into giving him money.
meanings.sent2: She reported the fraud to the authorities after discovering her bank account had been emptied by a thief.
meanings.sent3: The magician's act was so convincing, it almost seemed like a fraud to the audience!
meanings.sent4: The fraud of the Ponzi scheme left many investors devastated and broke.
meanings.sent5: The fraudster's elaborate scheme unraveled when his lies were finally exposed.

meanings.definition: A person or thing intended to deceive others, typically by unjustifiably claiming or being credited with accomplishments or qualities.
meanings.sent1: The celebrity impostor turned out to be a fraud pretending to be someone famous.
meanings.sent2: He was unmasked as a fraud when his fake credentials were discovered by the hiring manager.
meanings.sent3: The counterfeit designer handbag was a cheap fraud compared to the real luxury brand.
meanings.sent4: Her so-called friend was revealed to be a fraud who only pretended to care about her well-being.
meanings.sent5: The online seller was caught selling counterfeit goods, proving to be a fraud in the eyes of the customers.
